title: With Robotyne Recaptured, Ukraine Takes Next Step in Counteroffensive
description: After penetrating Russian defenses to retake the village of Robotyne, Ukrainian forces have pushed the fight a few miles east, but formidable obstacles lie ahead.

title: Keith Spicer, Canada’s Offbeat Envoy of Reconciliation, Dies at 89
description: As the country’s first commissioner of official languages, he oversaw a dual-language mandate. He later led a task force to listen to Canadians’ complaints.

title: Gabon’s Leader, Ali Bongo Ondimba, Was More Admired Abroad Than at Home
description: Hailed as a climate visionary, Gabon’s president, Ali Bongo Ondimba, was once welcomed to Buckingham Palace but was blindsided by this week’s coup.

title: Fire in Johannesburg, South Africa, Kills 74
description: Johannesburg, with a severe shortage of affordable housing, has hundreds of illegally occupied derelict buildings that officials and housing advocates say have become firetraps.

title: Friday Briefing: A Deadly Fire in South Africa
description: Also, the U.S. resists engaging with the Taliban.

title: Why the Johannesburg Apartment Building Was a Firetrap
description: A visit and imagery of the five-story building show that it had a litany of major safety issues that made it vulnerable to a deadly fire.

title: Humanity’s Ancestors Nearly Died Out, Genetic Study Suggests
description: The population crashed following climate change about 930,000 years ago, scientists concluded. Other experts aren’t convinced by the analysis.

title: More Than 100 Schools in England Ordered Closed Over Faulty Concrete
description: The news came just days before the start of the academic year for most children, even though critics say the risks have been known for some time.

title: U.K. Names Grant Shapps as New Defense Minister
description: Ben Wallace, a former soldier, championed the Ukrainians in their war against Russia. His successor, Grant Shapps, is best known for his political skills

title: Investigators Seize ‘Marcus Aurelius’ Statue From Cleveland Museum
description: The Manhattan district attorney’s office said the headless bronze, valued at $20 million, is a depiction of the Roman emperor and was looted from Turkey.

title: VanMoof, Trendy E-Bike Brand, Bought Out of Bankruptcy by Scooter Maker
description: Lavoie, which makes high-end scooters based on McLaren’s Formula 1 technology, acquired the trendy e-bike brand that had gained a zealous following.

title: Fire in Small Apparel Factory in the Philippines Kills at Least 15
description: Employees, the business owner and some of his relatives were among the dead at the shop near Manila. The cause of the blaze was unknown.

title: U.K. Replaces Defense Secretary Ben Wallace with Grant Shapps
description: Mr. Wallace, a former soldier, had come to symbolize Britain’s steadfast support for Ukraine in the war against Russia.

title: Johannesburg Fire Photos: Scenes From a Deadly Blaze
description: The blaze struck an abandoned building that had become a crowded squatter camp. The authorities were investigating the cause.

title: South Africa Fire: At Least 73 Dead in Building Fire in Johannesburg
description: The early-morning blaze tore through a five-story building that had become a sprawling informal settlement, officials said. The cause was not yet known.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Top Russian and Turkish Diplomats to Meet After Moscow Abandoned Grain Deal
description: Russia, which has targeted Ukraine’s grain facilities, is pitching an alternative to the deal  that appears aimed at helping its own exports.

title: At Least 63 Dead in Building Fire in Johannesburg
description: The early-morning blaze tore through a five-story building that had become a sprawling informal settlement, officials said. The cause was not yet known.

title: Thursday Briefing
description: Drone attacks in the war in Ukraine.

title: An Obsolete German Tank Seeks a Second Life on Ukraine’s Front Lines
description: The Cold War-era Leopard 1A5 may be old, but it is still effective, Germany says. The country is now training Ukrainian troops to operate the weapons.

title: Rare Protests in Syria Summon Echoes of Arab Spring
description: After 12 years of conflict, anger over growing economic hardships has boiled over. Protesters are demanding the ouster of the authoritarian President Bashar al-Assad and an end to the war.

title: The U.S. and China Are Talking Again. Where It Will Lead Is Unclear.
description: Gina Raimondo, the U.S. commerce secretary, and her Chinese counterparts agreed to continue economic talks, but such dialogues have a disheartening record.

title: A Resurgent Labour Party Sees Scotland as a Springboard to Power
description: As the Scottish nationalists stumble, a by-election near Glasgow this fall will test support for the opposition Labour party ahead of Britain’s coming general election.

title: China’s Misinformation Fuels Anger Over Fukushima Water Release
description: By exaggerating the risks from Japan’s discharge of treated wastewater, Beijing hopes to cast Japan and its allies as conspirators in malfeasance, analysts say.

title: Two Years After Afghanistan Exit, Biden Resists Calls for More Taliban Contact
description: Some U.S. officials had clung to the hope that the Taliban had moderated since they last controlled the country in the 1990s.
